alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:40PM PST until January 11 at 9:30AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Bear Creek above Mckee Road affecting Merced County. .A strong storm system bringing a periods of moderate to heavy rainfall to the central portion of the San Joaquin Valley and Sierra foothills through Tuesday will result in rapid runoff into the Merced River basin. For the Bear Creek...including Mckee Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bear Creek above Mckee Road. * WHEN...From this evening to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.7 feet, Flood of record - 4/4/2006. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM PST Monday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 24.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 22.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise above flood stage again tomorrow afternoon to 23.6 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage again early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 04/04/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (4 pm PST) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Bear Creek Mckee Road 23.0 17.0 Mon 2 pm PST 23.1 21.2 19.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight around 345 AM PST.
